intro: Dalechampia trifoliata var. trifida, commonly known as the three-leaf hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to Central America and the Caribbean. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are deeply lobed and often have a hairy texture. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Malvaceae family.
